title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Historic Outing by Stoudamire Lifts Raptors Past 76ers**

TORONTO – In a stunning individual display that will be etched in the franchise’s record books for years to come, Damon Stoudamire authored a masterpiece, pouring in a career-high 40 points to propel the Toronto Raptors to a 110-98 victory over the Philadelphia 76ers.

From the opening tip, it was clear this was Stoudamire’s night. The dynamic point guard was a blur of motion, slicing through the Philadelphia defense with an array of acrobatic drives and feathery pull-up jumpers. The 76ers had no answer for “Mighty Mouse,” who played with a relentless, scorching intensity that electrified the home crowd. His 40-point explosion was not just a personal best; it was a statement performance that announced the young Raptors as a team capable of spectacular feats.

While Stoudamire’s heroics dominated the narrative, he was not without support. Doug Christie provided a crucial all-around effort with 17 points, 8 rebounds, and 7 assists, serving as the perfect complement to the offensive fireworks. Marcus Camby controlled the paint, contributing a double-double with 14 points and 14 rebounds.

Philadelphia, despite a valiant 25-point effort from Jerry Stackhouse and a 19-point, 14-rebound double-double from Derrick Coleman, simply could not keep pace with the one-man offensive tsunami. Every time the 76ers threatened to close the gap, Stoudamire answered with another clutch basket, silencing the rally and extinguishing any hope of a comeback.

The final buzzer signaled more than just a win; it signaled the arrival of a franchise icon. On this night, the game ball belonged to one man, and the story was singular: Damon Stoudamire was unstoppable, and the Raptors rode his historic performance to a memorable victory.
